Class ConsoleBuilder

java.lang.Object
io.github.lambdaphoenix.simpleterminal.core.ConsoleBuilder
public class ConsoleBuilder extends Object
Provides a fluent API for building styled console output.

The ConsoleBuilder class allows the creation of formatted text with ANSI colors, styles, indentation, rules, and boxed content. Output can be accumulated in an internal buffer and then printed to the console.

Usage Example:

ConsoleBuilder cb = new ConsoleBuilder();
cb.color(AnsiColor.GREEN)
  .style(AnsiStyle.BOLD)
  .text("Hello, world!")
  .reset()
  .println();
Since:
0.1.0

      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • when

      public ConsoleBuilder when(boolean condition, Supplier<ConsoleBuilder> then)
      Executes the given supplier if the condition is true.

      This allows conditional building of console output in a fluent style.

      Parameters:
      condition - the condition to evaluate
      then - the supplier that is executed if condition is true
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • build

      public String build()
      Builds the accumulated output as a string.
      Returns:
      the built string

    • clear

      public ConsoleBuilder clear()
      Clears the internal buffer.
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints the accumulated output to System.out and clears the buffer.

    • println

      public void println()
      Appends a newline, prints the accumulated output to System.out, and clears the buffer.
